itemdesc-pistol-*:
Ammo: Bullet

Requires cocking lever for priming. Reload requires empty offhand.

Relatively weak but fast to reload. Can be shot from offhand. Carry a loaded pair for your wolf-problems.

Bronze wheel-lock pistol. Wheel creates sparks when rotates against a flint. Wheel is powered with clock spring. Copper alloys cannot produce sparks, so rusty gear is used for the wheel.

Hold 'Alt' to interact instead of aim/reload. Check 'Info log' chat for missing reload requirement.
itemdesc-arquebus-*:
Ammo: Bullet

Requires lit match for shooting. Reload and aiming requires empty offhand.

Strong enough to one-shot a Ram, which makes hunting them much more convinient. Higher powder consumption, longer reload and need to have a lit match makes it less suitable for self-defence role than a pair of pistols.

Match-lock firearm of relatively simple construction. Smoldering match is used for igniting priming powder.

Hold 'Alt' to interact instead of aim/reload.Check 'Info log' chat for missing reload requirement.
itemdesc-musket:
Ammo: Slug

Reload and aiming requires empty offhand.

The strongest of firearms capable of one-shoting most of the enemies. Can be equiped with a bayonet (plug bayonet requires hammer in offhand to remove it). High powder consumption, very long reload and high cost makes it less economically viable for general use.

Smooth-bore flint-lock firearm with long barrel cappable of using a bayonet. Long barrel makes it longer to ram a bullet.

Hold 'Alt' to interact instead of aim/reload. Check 'Info log' chat for missing reload requirement.
itemdesc-carbine:
Ammo: Slug

Reload and aiming requires empty offhand.

Not as strong as musket, but has faster reload and cheaper maintenance costs. Faster to aim and hinders movement less than a musket.

Smooth-bore flint-lock firearm with shortened barrel when compared to musket which makes it lighter and faster to reload.

Hold 'Alt' to interact instead of aim/reload. Check 'Info log' chat for missing reload requirement.
itemdesc-powderflask-*:
Stores gunpowder for use in firearms and protectes it from water. Flask durability represents amount of powder in the flask.

Take gunpowder in offhand and press right mouse button with flask in main hand to fill it.
itemdesc-cockinglever: Used to windup spring in wheel-lock pistol
itemdesc-bayonet-plug-*:
Attack power (attached): -4.8 hp
Attack tier (attached): 5
Attack range (attached): 4 m

Can be attached to a musket to turn it into a spear. On melee attack bayonet's durability is consumed instead of musket's

Plug style bayonet that is inserted in musket's barrels and fits firmly. Removal requires quite a bit of force and a hammer.

To attach/dettach use hotkey ('B' by default). Dettachment requires a hammer in offhand.
itemdesc-bayonet-socket-*:
Attack power (attached): -4.8 hp
Attack tier (attached): 5
Attack range (attached): 4 m

Can be attached to a musket to turn it into a spear. On melee attack bayonet's durability is consumed instead of musket's

Socket style bayonet that uses bayonet lug on a barrel. Allows to operate a gun while attached.

To attach/dettach use hotkey ('B' by default).
itemdesc-slug-*: High caliber bullet used by musket and carbine. Is cut from slug casting.
itemdesc-bullet-*: Small caliber bullet used by pistol and arquebus. Is cut from bullet casting.
itemdesc-gunpowder-wet:
Intermediate step in gunpowder production.

Wet blasting powder formed into small granules. Blasting powder is too fine for using in firearms. It burns inconsistently.
itemdesc-gunpowder-coarse:
Intermediate step in gunpowder production.

Dried up granules of powder. Still not usable in firearms: they are too big and will burn slowly.
itemdesc-gunpowder-fine:
Powder suitable for using in firearms. Can become wet swimming with it in inventory.

Fine granules of powder of consistent size suitable for using in fierams. Such powder burns consistently and fast.
itemdesc-match-*: Required to be lit for firing arquebus.
itemdesc-ammocasting-*: Put in offhand and cut with shears.
itemdesc-lock-wheellock: Complex lock that produces sparks by rotating iron wheel against flint.
itemdesc-lock-matchlock: Simple lock that just connects a trigger lever to the liver that holds a smoldering match.
itemdesc-lock-flintlock: Advanced lock that requires steel and knowlege of producing good quality springs.
itemdesc-ramrod-*: Is used to ram bullet and wadding down the barrel and to compact powder.
itemdesc-schematic-bayonet: Ancient schematic that contains description of a method of attaching bayonet to a barrel via lug and socket.
itemdesc-schematic-flintlock: Ancient schematic that describes intricate production of a leaf spring and a ignition mechanism that utilizes it.
